questions.question: Number of customers arriving in a unit time in the system is represented by?

explanations.a: Mean arrival rate is defined as the number of arrivals per unit time
explanations.b: Mean service rate is defined as the number of customers served per unit time
explanations.c: Simulation speed is the extent of speed with which simulation of an experiment is performed
explanations.d: Start is used to simulate the experiment for the given values of parameters

questions.question: What does the number of servers in the system represent?

answers.a: Number of customers arriving for the service
answers.b: Total number of service providers in the system
answers.c: Number of service providers providing service at any instant in the system
answers.d: Number of service providers which are idle at any instant in the system

explanations.a: Mean arrival rate is defined as the number of arrivals per unit time
explanations.b: Mean service rate is defined as the number of customers served per unit time
explanations.c: Number of service providers providing service at any instant in the system
explanations.d: Start is used to simulate the experiment for the given values of parameters

questions.question: What is the relationship between the mean arrival rate and mean service rate for the existence of a steady-state solution?

answers.a: Mean arrival rate = Mean service rate
answers.b: Mean arrival rate = Number of servers times the mean service rate
answers.c: Mean arrival rate < Number of servers times the mean service rate
answers.d: Mean arrival rate < Mean service rate

explanations.a: For mean arrival rate equals to mean service rate, traffic intensity equals to 1, which leads an infinite number of customers in the system
explanations.b: In this case, the system will collapse due to more arrival in comparison to service in a unit time
explanations.c: This leads to steady-state solution as arrivals are less than service in a unit time
explanations.d: In this case, the system will collapse due to more arrivals in comparison to service in a unit time when the arrival rate becomes greater than the service rate

questions.question: Little's law defines the relationship between which of the following measures?

answers.a: Mean arrival rate and mean service rate
answers.b: Mean arrival rate and traffic intensity
answers.c: Mean sevice rate and traffic intensity
answers.d: Average number of customers in the system and waiting time in the system

explanations.d: According to Little's law average number of customers in the system is the mean arrival rate time waiting time of a customer in the system

questions.question: In a Tea shop run by one servant, the queueing model will be best suited is?

answers.c: Single server with general arrival process model

explanations.c: Since the customers are served by one person and the service time follows a general distribution
